author: Megumi Fujikawa
title: Japan’s Core Inflation Softens in April
text:
TOKYO—Japanese prices rose more slowly in April, showing how the tight job market has yet to build momentum for the Bank of Japan to reach its 2% inflation target.
Government data released Friday showed that core inflation—which measures all items except fresh food—was 0.7% in April, down from 0.9% in March, while another inflation measure that strips out both energy and fresh food stood at 0.4%, down from 0.5%.
